page.title: 17HOLCOMBE VILLAGE
page.content: For many centuries Holcombe was used for{hunting}by the lords of the manor.Up until a few years ago it was a farming community but it is now mainly residential, some of the old farm-buildings having been renovated .The village was most active in the 17th. and 18th. centuries, when domestic weaving supplemented farming.Most of the buildings date from then,and thus Holcombe is an example of a pre-industrial hill-side settlement. The{church}in the village is built in a revived Gothic style and the buildings, lych-gate, boundary-walls and the gravestones are in natural stone. The roof is made of stone flag and slate. In the village there is a {riding-stables for the disabled. }
